Grid data from Slater (1977).

Source: R/data-openrepgrid.r
data-slater1977b.Rd

Grid data (ranked) from a seventeen year old female psychiatric patient (Slater, 1977, p. 110). She was depressed, anxious and took to cutting herself. The data was originally reported by Watson (1970).

References

Slater, P. (1977). The measurement of intrapersonal space by grid technique. London: Wiley.

Watson, J. P. (1970). The relationship between a self-mutilating patient and her doctor. Psychotherapy and Psychosomatics, 18(1), 67-73.

Examples

slater1977b
#> 
#> META DATA:
#> Number of elements:  10 
#> Number of constructs:  10 
#> Preferred poles defined:  0/10 
#> 
#> SCALE INFO:
#> The grid is rated on a scale from 1 (left pole) to 10 (right pole)
#> 
#> RATINGS:
#>                    Being at home - 5 6 - Being in hospital                
#>                      Seeing G. - 4 | | 7 - Being with my mother           
#>            Being in a crowd - 3  | | | |  8 - Being with Dr. W.           
#> g the same thoughts for a - 2 |  | | | |  |  9 - Being with Mrs. M.       
#>  to talk to someone and - 1 | |  | | | |  |  |  10 - Being with my father 
#>                           | | |  | | | |  |  |  |                         
#>                    (.1)   2 1  3 6 4 5  7  8 10 9   (1.) Make me cut mysel
#>                    (.2)   1 3  6 2 4 7  5  8 10 9   (2.) Make me think peo
#>                    (.3)   2 5  3 1 4 6  7 10  9 8   (3.) Make me feel depr
#>                    (.4)   1 2  4 3 7 6 10  5  8 9   (4.) Make me feel angr
#>                    (.5)   2 3  5 1 9 7 10  4  6 8   (5.) Make me feel scar
#>                    (.6)   5 4  7 1 2 6  3  9 10 8   (6.) Make me feel more
#>                    (.7)   2 7  5 9 1 8  3  6 10 4   (7.) Make me feel more
#>                    (.8)   9 8  7 1 5 6  4  2 10 3   (8.) Make me feel lone
#>                    (.9)   5 9 10 1 8 2  6  3  4 7   (9.) Help me in the lo
#>                   (.10)   9 8 10 1 5 6  3  4  7 2   (10.) Make me feel che
#> 
#> Poles: (+) = preferred , (-) = non-preferred , (/) = none , (.) = not defined
